She didn‚Äôt drop the phone, she didn‚Äôt take pauses. She showed exactly what occurred & that led the jury to convict.

Be like Darnella. Film the cops. But also be loud and speak out against injustices you see. Don‚Äôt be a silent bystander.

& Darnella Frazier is one of the heroes that made this trial possible. Her steady hand unwaveringly captured Floyd the entire time. 

It allowed the key witness, Dr. Tobin, to count out the last 8 breaths took, pointing at the exact moment Floyd's face changed from life to death
There are still many more #GeorgeFloyd every damn day. We can‚Äôt let up now.

#BLM is not about murder trials or being against police, but about preventing the need for these types of trials in the future. It‚Äôs about stopping the system of oppression that causes police to discriminate against black people in the first place.

What a f*g breath of fresh air to have accountability.

That is all this trial was - a guilty man being forced to have accountability for his actions. This isn‚Äôt a celebration; we didn‚Äôt end racism & quite frankly we barely took a step in that direction.

We should automatically register everyone to vote when they turn 18, have an automated system updating that registration when people move, permit registration up to & on Election Day, and make Election Day a federal holiday. Only then you can require IDs

& also I don't know anyone saying that people shouldn't have an ID to vote, but the new reqs shouldn't be created when the system is already so inefficient. We're adding new obstacles for people who don't have the same luxury of time or resources

Why are we arguing if giving water to people waiting in line to vote is a political act vs. a charitable one, rather than asking why people are waiting so long to vote? Forget water/no water... long lines = supression. #VoterSupressionIsUnAmerican

If you think there's no such thing as systemic racism, ask yourself why we know about #GeorgeFloyd past drug use, but barely any coverage that #DerekChauvin kneeled on another teen's back for 17 minutes in 2017 while he said he couldn't breathe

How many times do we have to go through this before we see meaningful reform? How many Black men will unnecessarily die at the hands of police? Enough is enough. End QI & hold bad (even by mistake - manslaughter is still manslaughter) cops accountable 

#DaunteWright #SayHisName
